4204    /**
4205     * Generate a sentence from this FakeLanguageGen using the specific RNG. The sentence's length in
4206     * words will be between minWords and maxWords, both inclusive. It will put one of the punctuation Strings from
4207     * {@code midPunctuation} between two words (before the space) at a frequency of {@code midPunctuationFrequency}
4208     * (between 0 and 1), and will end the sentence with one String chosen from {@code endPunctuation}.
4209     *
4210     * @param rng                     the RNG to use for the randomized string building
4211     * @param minWords                an int for the minimum number of words in a sentence; should be at least 1
4212     * @param maxWords                an int for the maximum number of words in a sentence; should be at least equal to minWords
4213     * @param midPunctuation          a String array where each element is a comma, semicolon, or the like that goes before a
4214     *                                space in the middle of a sentence
4215     * @param endPunctuation          a String array where each element is a period, question mark, or the like that goes at
4216     *                                the very end of a sentence
4217     * @param midPunctuationFrequency a double between 0.0 and 1.0 that determines how often Strings from
4218     *                                midPunctuation should be inserted before spaces
4219     * @return a sentence in the fake language as a String
4220     */
4221    public String sentence(IRNG rng, int minWords, int maxWords, String[] midPunctuation, String[] endPunctuation,
4222                           double midPunctuationFrequency) {
4223        if (minWords < 1)
4224            minWords = 1;
4225        if (minWords > maxWords)
4226            maxWords = minWords;
4227        if (midPunctuationFrequency > 1.0) {
4228            midPunctuationFrequency = 1.0 / midPunctuationFrequency;
4229        }
4230        ssb.setLength(0);
4231        ssb.ensureCapacity(12 * maxWords);
4232        ssb.append(word(rng, true));
4233        for (int i = 1; i < minWords; i++) {
4234            if (rng.nextDouble() < midPunctuationFrequency) {
4235                ssb.append(rng.getRandomElement(midPunctuation));
4236            }
4237            ssb.append(' ').append(word(rng, false));
4238        }
4239        for (int i = minWords; i < maxWords && rng.nextInt(2 * maxWords) > i; i++) {
4240            if (rng.nextDouble() < midPunctuationFrequency) {
4241                ssb.append(rng.getRandomElement(midPunctuation));
4242            }
4243            ssb.append(' ').append(word(rng, false));
4244        }
4245        if (endPunctuation != null && endPunctuation.length > 0)
4246            ssb.append(rng.getRandomElement(endPunctuation));
4247        return ssb.toString();
4248    }

4300     * sentence's length in words will be between minWords and maxWords, both inclusive, unless it would exceed
4301     * maxChars, in which case it is truncated. It will put one of the punctuation Strings from {@code midPunctuation}

4307     * @param maxWords                an int for the maximum number of words in a sentence; should be at least equal to minWords
4308     * @param midPunctuation          a String array where each element is a comma, semicolon, or the like that goes before a
4309     *                                space in the middle of a sentence
4310     * @param endPunctuation          a String array where each element is a period, question mark, or the like that goes at
4311     *                                the very end of a sentence
4312     * @param midPunctuationFrequency a double between 0.0 and 1.0 that determines how often Strings from
4313     *                                midPunctuation should be inserted before spaces
4314     * @param maxChars                the longest string length this can produce; should be at least {@code 6 * minWords}
4315     * @return a sentence in the fake language as a String
4316     */
4317    public String sentence(IRNG rng, int minWords, int maxWords, String[] midPunctuation, String[] endPunctuation,
4318                           double midPunctuationFrequency, int maxChars) {
4319        if(maxChars < 0)
4320            return sentence(rng, minWords, maxWords, midPunctuation, endPunctuation, midPunctuationFrequency);
4321        if (minWords < 1)
4322            minWords = 1;
4323        if (minWords > maxWords)
4324            maxWords = minWords;
4325        if (midPunctuationFrequency > 1.0) {
4326            midPunctuationFrequency = 1.0 / midPunctuationFrequency;
4327        }
4328        if (maxChars < 4)
4329            return "!";
4330        if (maxChars <= 5 * minWords) {
4331            minWords = 1;
4332            maxWords = 1;
4333        }
4334        int frustration = 0;
4335        ssb.setLength(0); 
4336        ssb.ensureCapacity(maxChars);
4337        String next = word(rng, true);
4338        while (next.length() >= maxChars - 1 && frustration < 50) {
4339            next = word(rng, true);
4340            frustration++;
4341        }
4342        if (frustration >= 50) return "!";
4343        ssb.append(next);
4344        for (int i = 1; i < minWords && ssb.length() < maxChars - 7; i++) {
4345            if (rng.nextDouble() < midPunctuationFrequency && ssb.length() < maxChars - 3) {
4346                ssb.append(rng.getRandomElement(midPunctuation));
4347            }
4348            next = word(rng, false);
4349            while (ssb.length() + next.length() >= maxChars - 2 && frustration < 50) {
4350                next = word(rng, false);
4351                frustration++;
4352            }
4353            if (frustration >= 50) break;
4354            ssb.append(' ').append(next);
4355        }
4356        for (int i = minWords; i < maxWords && ssb.length() < maxChars - 7 && rng.nextInt(2 * maxWords) > i && frustration < 50; i++) {
4357            if (rng.nextDouble() < midPunctuationFrequency && ssb.length() < maxChars - 3) {
4358                ssb.append(rng.getRandomElement(midPunctuation));
4359            }
4360            next = word(rng, false);
4361            while (ssb.length() + next.length() >= maxChars - 2 && frustration < 50) {
4362                next = word(rng, false);
4363                frustration++;
4364            }
4365            if (frustration >= 50) break;
4366            ssb.append(' ');
4367            ssb.append(next);
4368        }
4369
4370        if (endPunctuation != null && endPunctuation.length > 0) {
4371
4372            next = rng.getRandomElement(endPunctuation);
4373            if (ssb.length() + next.length() >= maxChars)
4374                ssb.append('.');
4375            else
4376                ssb.append(next);
4377        }
4378
4379        if (ssb.length() > maxChars)
4380            return "!";
4381        return ssb.toString();
4382    }
4383
4384    protected String[] merge1000(IRNG rng, String[] me, String[] other, double otherInfluence) {
4385        if (other.length <= 0 && me.length <= 0)
4386            return new String[]{};
4387        String[] ret = new String[1000];
4388        int otherCount = (int) (1000 * otherInfluence);
4389        int idx = 0;
4390        if (other.length > 0) {
4391            String[] tmp = new String[other.length];
4392            rng.shuffle(other, tmp);
4393            for (idx = 0; idx < otherCount; idx++) {
4394                ret[idx] = tmp[idx % tmp.length];
4395            }
4396        }
4397        if (me.length > 0) {
4398            String[] tmp = new String[me.length];
4399            rng.shuffle(me, tmp);
4400            for (; idx < 1000; idx++) {
4401                ret[idx] = tmp[idx % tmp.length];
4402            }
4403        } else {
4404            for (; idx < 1000; idx++) {
4405                ret[idx] = other[idx % other.length];
4406            }
4407        }
4408        return ret;
4409    }

4412    protected static String[] accentVowels(IRNG rng, String[] me, double influence) {
4413        String[] ret = new String[1000];
4414        int otherCount = (int) (1000 * influence);
4415        int idx;
4416        Matcher matcher;
4417        if (me.length > 0) {
4418            String[] tmp = new String[me.length];
4419            rng.shuffle(me, tmp);
4420            for (idx = 0; idx < otherCount; idx++) {
4421                ret[idx] = tmp[idx % tmp.length]
4422                        .replace('a', accentedVowels[0][rng.nextInt(accentedVowels[0].length)])
4423                        .replace('e', accentedVowels[1][rng.nextInt(accentedVowels[1].length)])
4424                        .replace('i', accentedVowels[2][rng.nextInt(accentedVowels[2].length)])
4425                        .replace('o', accentedVowels[3][rng.nextInt(accentedVowels[3].length)])
4426                        .replace('u', accentedVowels[4][rng.nextInt(accentedVowels[4].length)]);
4427                matcher = repeats.matcher(ret[idx]);
4428                if (matcher.find()) {
4429                    ret[idx] = matcher.replaceAll(rng.getRandomElement(me));
4430                }
4431            }
4432            for (; idx < 1000; idx++) {
4433                ret[idx] = tmp[idx % tmp.length];
4434            }
4435        } else
4436            return new String[]{};
4437        return ret;
4438    }

4575
4576    /**
4577     * Makes a new FakeLanguageGen that mixes this object with {@code other}, mingling the consonants and vowels they
4578     * use as well as any word suffixes or other traits, and favoring the qualities in {@code other} by
4579     * {@code otherInfluence}, which will value both languages evenly if it is 0.5 . 
4580     * <br>
4581     * You should generally prefer {@link #mix(double, FakeLanguageGen, double, Object...)} or
4582     * {@link #mixAll(Object...)} if you ever mix 3 or more languages. Chaining this mix() method can be very
4583     * counter-intuitive because the weights are relative, while in the other mix() and mixAll() they are absolute.
4584     * @param other another FakeLanguageGen to mix along with this one into a new language
4585     * @param otherInfluence how much other should affect the pair, with 0.5 being equal and 1.0 being only other used
4586     * @return a new FakeLanguageGen with traits from both languages
4587     */
4588    public FakeLanguageGen mix(FakeLanguageGen other, double otherInfluence) {
4589        otherInfluence = Math.max(0.0, Math.min(otherInfluence, 1.0));
4590        double myInfluence = 1.0 - otherInfluence;
4591
4592        GWTRNG rng = new GWTRNG(hashCode(), other.hashCode() ^ NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(otherInfluence));
4593
4594        String[] ov = merge1000(rng, openingVowels, other.openingVowels, otherInfluence),
4595                mv = merge1000(rng, midVowels, other.midVowels, otherInfluence),
4596                oc = merge1000(rng, openingConsonants, other.openingConsonants, otherInfluence *
4597                        Math.max(0.0, Math.min(1.0, 1.0 - other.vowelStartFrequency + vowelStartFrequency))),
4598                mc = merge1000(rng, midConsonants, other.midConsonants, otherInfluence),
4599                cc = merge1000(rng, closingConsonants, other.closingConsonants, otherInfluence *
4600                        Math.max(0.0, Math.min(1.0, 1.0 - other.vowelEndFrequency + vowelEndFrequency))),
4601                cs = merge1000(rng, closingSyllables, other.closingSyllables, otherInfluence *
4602                        Math.max(0.0, Math.min(1.0, other.syllableEndFrequency - syllableEndFrequency))),
4603                splitters = merge1000(rng, vowelSplitters, other.vowelSplitters, otherInfluence);
4604
4605        double[] fr = new double[Math.max(syllableFrequencies.length, other.syllableFrequencies.length)];
4606        System.arraycopy(syllableFrequencies, 0, fr, 0, syllableFrequencies.length);
4607        for (int i = 0; i < other.syllableFrequencies.length; i++) {
4608            fr[i] += other.syllableFrequencies[i];
4609        }
4610        ArrayList<Modifier> mods = new ArrayList<>(modifiers.size() + other.modifiers.size());
4611        mods.addAll(modifiers);
4612        mods.addAll(other.modifiers);
4613        return new FakeLanguageGen(ov, mv, oc, mc, cc, cs, splitters, fr,
4614                vowelStartFrequency * myInfluence + other.vowelStartFrequency * otherInfluence,
4615                vowelEndFrequency * myInfluence + other.vowelEndFrequency * otherInfluence,
4616                vowelSplitFrequency * myInfluence + other.vowelSplitFrequency * otherInfluence,
4617                syllableEndFrequency * myInfluence + other.syllableEndFrequency * otherInfluence,
4618                (sanityChecks == null) ? other.sanityChecks : sanityChecks, true, mods)
4619                .setName(otherInfluence > 0.5 ? other.name + "/" + name : name + "/" + other.name);
4620    }
4621
4622    private static double readDouble(Object o) {
4623        if (o instanceof Double) return (Double) o;
4624        else if (o instanceof Float) return (Float) o;
4625        else if (o instanceof Long) return ((Long) o).doubleValue();
4626        else if (o instanceof Integer) return (Integer) o;
4627        else if (o instanceof Short) return (Short) o;
4628        else if (o instanceof Byte) return (Byte) o;
4629        else if (o instanceof Character) return (Character) o;
4630        return 0.0;
4631    }
4632
4633    /**
4634     * Produces a FakeLanguageGen by mixing this FakeLanguageGen with one or more other FakeLanguageGen objects. Takes
4635     * a weight for this, another FakeLanguageGen, a weight for that FakeLanguageGen, then a possibly-empty group of
4636     * FakeLanguageGen parameters and the weights for those parameters. If other1 is null or if pairs has been given a
4637     * value of null instead of the normal (possibly empty) array of Objects, then this simply returns a copy of this
4638     * FakeLanguageGen. Otherwise, it will at least mix this language with other1 using the given weights for each.
4639     * If pairs is not empty, it has special requirements for what types it allows and in what order, but does no type
4640     * checking. Specifically, pairs requires the first Object to be a FakeLanguageGen, the next to be a number of some
4641     * kind that will be the weight for the previous FakeLanguageGen(this method can handle non-Double weights, and
4642     * converts them to Double if needed), and every two parameters after that to follow the same order and pattern
4643     * (FakeLanguageGen, then number, then FakeLanguageGen, then number...). Weights are absolute, and don't depend on
4644     * earlier weights, which is the case when chaining the {@link #mix(FakeLanguageGen, double)} method. This makes
4645     * reasoning about the ideal weights for multiple mixed languages easier; to mix 3 languages equally you can use
4646     * 3 equal weights with this, whereas with mix chaining you would need to mix the first two with 0.5 and the third
4647     * with 0.33 .
4648     * <br>
4649     * It's up to you whether you want to use {@link #mixAll(Object...)} or this method; they call the same code and
4650     * produce the same result, including the summary for serialization support. You probably shouldn't use
4651     * {@link #mix(FakeLanguageGen, double)} with two arguments in new code, since it's easy to make mistakes when
4652     * mixing three or more languages (calling that twice or more).
4653     *
4654     * @param myWeight the weight to assign this FakeLanguageGen in the mix
4655     * @param other1   another FakeLanguageGen to mix in; if null, this method will abort and return {@link #copy()}
4656     * @param weight1  the weight to assign other1 in the mix
4657     * @param pairs    may be empty, not null; otherwise must alternate between FakeLanguageGen and number (weight) elements
4658     * @return a FakeLanguageGen produced by mixing this with any FakeLanguageGen arguments by the given weights
4659     */
4660    public FakeLanguageGen mix(double myWeight, FakeLanguageGen other1, double weight1, Object... pairs) {
4661        if (other1 == null || pairs == null)
4662            return copy();
4663        OrderedSet<Modifier> mods = new OrderedSet<>(modifiers);
4664        FakeLanguageGen mixer = removeModifiers();
4665        FakeLanguageGen[] languages = new FakeLanguageGen[2 + (pairs.length >>> 1)];
4666        double[] weights = new double[languages.length];
4667        String[] summaries = new String[languages.length];
4668        boolean summarize = true;
4669        double total = 0.0, current, weight;
4670        languages[0] = mixer;
4671        total += weights[0] = myWeight;
4672        if ((summaries[0] = mixer.summary) == null) summarize = false;
4673        mods.addAll(other1.modifiers);
4674        languages[1] = other1.removeModifiers();
4675        total += weights[1] = weight1;
4676        if (summarize && (summaries[1] = languages[1].summary) == null) summarize = false;
4677        for (int i = 1, p = 2; i < pairs.length; i += 2, p++) {
4678            if (pairs[i] == null || pairs[i - 1] == null)
4679                continue;
4680            languages[p] = ((FakeLanguageGen) pairs[i - 1]).removeModifiers();
4681            total += weights[p] = readDouble(pairs[i]);
4682            if (summarize && (summaries[p] = languages[p].summary) == null) summarize = false;
4683        }
4684        if (total == 0)
4685            return copy();
4686        current = myWeight / total;
4687        for (int i = 1; i < languages.length; i++) {
4688            if ((weight = weights[i]) > 0)
4689                mixer = mixer.mix(languages[i], weight / total / (current += weight / total));
4690        }
4691        if (summarize) {
4692            sb.setLength(0);
4693            String c;
4694            int idx;
4695            for (int i = 0; i < summaries.length; i++) {
4696                c = summaries[i];
4697                idx = c.indexOf('@');
4698                if (idx >= 0) {
4699                    sb.append(c, 0, idx + 1).append(weights[i]);
4700                    if (i < summaries.length - 1)
4701                        sb.append('~');
4702                }
4703            }
4704            return mixer.summarize(sb.toString()).addModifiers(mods);
4705        } else
4706            return mixer.addModifiers(mods);
4707    }
4708
4709    /**
4710     * Produces a FakeLanguageGen from a group of FakeLanguageGen parameters and the weights for those parameters.
4711     * Requires the first Object in pairs to be a FakeLanguageGen, the next to be a number of some kind that will be the
4712     * weight for the previous FakeLanguageGen(this method can handle non-Double weights, and converts them to Double
4713     * if needed), and every two parameters after that to follow the same order and pattern (FakeLanguageGen, then
4714     * number, then FakeLanguageGen, then number...). There should be at least 4 elements in pairs, half of them
4715     * languages and half of them weights, for this to do any mixing, but it can produce a result with as little as one
4716     * FakeLanguageGen (returning a copy of the first FakeLanguageGen). Weights are absolute, and don't depend on
4717     * earlier weights, which is the case when chaining the {@link #mix(FakeLanguageGen, double)} method. This makes
4718     * reasoning about the ideal weights for multiple mixed languages easier; to mix 3 languages equally you can use
4719     * 3 equal weights with this, whereas with mix chaining you would need to mix the first two with 0.5 and the third
4720     * with 0.33 .
4721     * <br>
4722     * This is probably the most intuitive way to mix languages here, though there's also
4723     * {@link #mix(double, FakeLanguageGen, double, Object...)}, which is very similar but doesn't take its parameters
4724     * in quite the same way (it isn't static, and treats the FakeLanguageGen object like the first item in pairs here).
4725     * Used internally in the deserialization code.
4726     *
4727     * @param pairs should have at least one item, and must alternate between FakeLanguageGen and number (weight) elements
4728     * @return a FakeLanguageGen produced by mixing any FakeLanguageGen arguments by the given weights
4729     */
4730    public static FakeLanguageGen mixAll(Object... pairs) {
4731        int len;
4732        if (pairs == null || (len = pairs.length) <= 0)
4733            return ENGLISH.copy();
4734        if (len < 4)
4735            return ((FakeLanguageGen) pairs[0]).copy();
4736        Object[] pairs2 = new Object[len - 4];
4737        if (len > 4)
4738            System.arraycopy(pairs, 4, pairs2, 0, len - 4);
4739        return ((FakeLanguageGen) pairs[0]).mix(readDouble(pairs[1]), (FakeLanguageGen) pairs[2], readDouble(pairs[3]), pairs2);
4740    }
4741
4742    /**
4743     * Produces a new FakeLanguageGen like this one but with extra vowels and/or consonants possible, adding from a wide
4744     * selection of accented vowels (if vowelInfluence is above 0.0) and/or consonants (if consonantInfluence is above
4745     * 0.0). This may produce a gibberish-looking language with no rhyme or reason to the accents, and generally
4746     * consonantInfluence should be very low if it is above 0 at all.
4747     * @param vowelInfluence between 0.0 and 1.0; if 0.0 will not affect vowels at all
4748     * @param consonantInfluence between 0.0 and 1.0; if 0.0 will not affect consonants at all
4749     * @return a new FakeLanguageGen with modifications to add accented vowels and/or consonants
4750     */
4751    public FakeLanguageGen addAccents(double vowelInfluence, double consonantInfluence) {
4752        vowelInfluence = Math.max(0.0, Math.min(vowelInfluence, 1.0));
4753        consonantInfluence = Math.max(0.0, Math.min(consonantInfluence, 1.0));
4754        GWTRNG rng = new GWTRNG(hashCode(),
4755                NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(vowelInfluence)
4756                        ^ NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(consonantInfluence));
4757        String[] ov = accentVowels(rng, openingVowels, vowelInfluence),
4758                mv = accentVowels(rng, midVowels, vowelInfluence),
4759                oc = accentConsonants(rng, openingConsonants, consonantInfluence),
4760                mc = accentConsonants(rng, midConsonants, consonantInfluence),
4761                cc = accentConsonants(rng, closingConsonants, consonantInfluence),
4762                cs = accentBoth(rng, closingSyllables, vowelInfluence, consonantInfluence);
4763
4764
4765        return new FakeLanguageGen(ov, mv, oc, mc, cc, cs, vowelSplitters, syllableFrequencies,
4766                vowelStartFrequency,
4767                vowelEndFrequency,
4768                vowelSplitFrequency,
4769                syllableEndFrequency, sanityChecks, clean, modifiers).setName(name + "-Bònüs");
4770    }
4771
4772    private static String[] copyStrings(String[] start) {
4773        String[] next = new String[start.length];
4774        System.arraycopy(start, 0, next, 0, start.length);
4775        return next;
4776    }

4778    /**
4779     * Useful for cases with limited fonts, this produces a new FakeLanguageGen like this one but with all accented
4780     * characters removed (including almost all non-ASCII Latin-alphabet characters, but only some Greek and Cyrillic
4781     * characters). This will replace letters like "A with a ring" with just "A". Some of the letters chosen as
4782     * replacements aren't exact matches.
4783     * @return a new FakeLanguageGen like this one but without accented letters
4784     */
4785    public FakeLanguageGen removeAccents() {
4786
4787        String[] ov = copyStrings(openingVowels),
4788                mv = copyStrings(midVowels),
4789                oc = copyStrings(openingConsonants),
4790                mc = copyStrings(midConsonants),
4791                cc = copyStrings(closingConsonants),
4792                cs = copyStrings(closingSyllables);
4793        for (int i = 0; i < ov.length; i++) {
4794            ov[i] = removeAccents(openingVowels[i]).toString();
4795        }
4796        for (int i = 0; i < mv.length; i++) {
4797            mv[i] = removeAccents(midVowels[i]).toString();
4798        }
4799        for (int i = 0; i < oc.length; i++) {
4800            oc[i] = removeAccents(openingConsonants[i]).toString();
4801        }
4802        for (int i = 0; i < mc.length; i++) {
4803            mc[i] = removeAccents(midConsonants[i]).toString();
4804        }
4805        for (int i = 0; i < cc.length; i++) {
4806            cc[i] = removeAccents(closingConsonants[i]).toString();
4807        }
4808        for (int i = 0; i < cs.length; i++) {
4809            cs[i] = removeAccents(closingSyllables[i]).toString();
4810        }
4811
4812        return new FakeLanguageGen(ov, mv, oc, mc, cc, cs, vowelSplitters, syllableFrequencies,
4813                vowelStartFrequency,
4814                vowelEndFrequency,
4815                vowelSplitFrequency,
4816                syllableEndFrequency, sanityChecks, clean, modifiers);
4817    }

4822     * produce a String like "English/French" (or "English/French/Maori" if more are mixed together). If no name was
4823     * registered, this will return "Nameless Language".
4824     * @return the human-readable name of this language, or "Nameless Language" if none is known

4836     * Adds the specified Modifier objects from a Collection to a copy of this FakeLanguageGen and returns it.
4837     * You can obtain a Modifier with the static constants in the FakeLanguageGen.Modifier nested class, the
4838     * FakeLanguageGen.modifier() method, or Modifier's constructor.
4839     *
4840     * @param mods an array or vararg of Modifier objects
4841     * @return a copy of this with the Modifiers added
4842     */
4843    public FakeLanguageGen addModifiers(Collection<Modifier> mods) {
4844        FakeLanguageGen next = copy();
4845        next.modifiers.addAll(mods);
4846        if(next.summary != null){
4847            sb.setLength(0);
4848            sb.append(next.summary);
4849            for (int i = 0; i < mods.size(); i++) {
4850                sb.append('℗').append(next.modifiers.get(i).serializeToString());
4851            }
4852            next.summarize(sb.toString());
4853        }
4854        return next;
4855    }

4884    public FakeLanguageGen removeModifiers() {

4913    @Override
4914    public boolean equals(Object o) {
4915        if (this == o) return true;
4916        if (o == null || getClass() != o.getClass()) return false;
4917
4918        FakeLanguageGen that = (FakeLanguageGen) o;
4919
4920        if (clean != that.clean) return false;
4921        if (Double.compare(that.totalSyllableFrequency, totalSyllableFrequency) != 0) return false;
4922        if (Double.compare(that.vowelStartFrequency, vowelStartFrequency) != 0) return false;
4923        if (Double.compare(that.vowelEndFrequency, vowelEndFrequency) != 0) return false;
4924        if (Double.compare(that.vowelSplitFrequency, vowelSplitFrequency) != 0) return false;
4925        if (Double.compare(that.syllableEndFrequency, syllableEndFrequency) != 0) return false;
4926        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4927        if (!Arrays.equals(openingVowels, that.openingVowels)) return false;
4928        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4929        if (!Arrays.equals(midVowels, that.midVowels)) return false;
4930        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4931        if (!Arrays.equals(openingConsonants, that.openingConsonants)) return false;
4932        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4933        if (!Arrays.equals(midConsonants, that.midConsonants)) return false;
4934        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4935        if (!Arrays.equals(closingConsonants, that.closingConsonants)) return false;
4936        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4937        if (!Arrays.equals(vowelSplitters, that.vowelSplitters)) return false;
4938        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4939        if (!Arrays.equals(closingSyllables, that.closingSyllables)) return false;
4940        if (!Arrays.equals(syllableFrequencies, that.syllableFrequencies)) return false;
4941        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4942        if (!Arrays.equals(sanityChecks, that.sanityChecks)) return false;
4943        return modifiers != null ? modifiers.equals(that.modifiers) : that.modifiers == null;
4944    }

4946    @Override
4947    public int hashCode() {
4948        int result = 31 * 31 * 31 * 31 +
4949                31 * 31 * 31 * CrossHash.hash(openingVowels) +
4950                31 * 31 * CrossHash.hash(midVowels) +
4951                31 * CrossHash.hash(openingConsonants) +
4952                CrossHash.hash(midConsonants) | 0;
4953        result = 31 * 31 * 31 * 31 * result +
4954                31 * 31 * 31 * CrossHash.hash(closingConsonants) +
4955                31 * 31 * CrossHash.hash(vowelSplitters) +
4956                31 * CrossHash.hash(closingSyllables) ^
4957                (clean ? 1 : 0);
4958        result = 31 * 31 * 31 * 31 * result +
4959                31 * 31 * 31 * CrossHash.hash(syllableFrequencies) +
4960                31 * 31 * NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(totalSyllableFrequency) +
4961                31 * NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(vowelStartFrequency) +
4962                NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(vowelEndFrequency) | 0;
4963        result = 31 * 31 * 31 * 31 * result +
4964                31 * 31 * 31 * (sanityChecks != null ? sanityChecks.length + 1 : 0) +
4965                31 * 31 * NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(syllableEndFrequency) +                 
4966                31 * NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(vowelSplitFrequency) | 0;
4967        if(modifiers != null) {
4968            for (int i = 0; i < modifiers.size(); i++) {
4969                result = result + 7 * (i + 1) * modifiers.get(i).hashCode() | 0;
4970            }
4971        }
4972        return result;
4973    }
4974    public long hash64() {
4975        long result           = CrossHash.hash64(openingVowels);
4976        result = 31L * result + CrossHash.hash64(midVowels);
4977        result = 31L * result + CrossHash.hash64(openingConsonants);
4978        result = 31L * result + CrossHash.hash64(midConsonants);
4979        result = 31L * result + CrossHash.hash64(closingConsonants);
4980        result = 31L * result + CrossHash.hash64(vowelSplitters);
4981        result = 31L * result + CrossHash.hash64(closingSyllables);
4982        result = 31L * result + CrossHash.hash64(syllableFrequencies);
4983        result = 31L * result + (clean ? 1L : 0L);
4984        result = 31L * result + NumberTools.doubleToLongBits(totalSyllableFrequency);
4985        result = 31L * result + NumberTools.doubleToLongBits(vowelStartFrequency);
4986        result = 31L * result + NumberTools.doubleToLongBits(vowelEndFrequency);
4987        result = 31L * result + NumberTools.doubleToLongBits(vowelSplitFrequency);
4988        result = 31L * result + NumberTools.doubleToLongBits(syllableEndFrequency);
4989        result = 31L * result + (sanityChecks != null ? sanityChecks.length + 1L : 0L);
4990        result *= 31L;
4991        if(modifiers != null) {
4992            for (int i = 0; i < modifiers.size(); i++) {
4993                result += 7L * (i + 1L) * CrossHash.hash64(modifiers.get(i).alterations);
4994            }
4995        }
4996        return result;
4997    }

5032
5033    public static FakeLanguageGen deserializeFromString(String data) {
5034        if (data == null || data.equals(""))
5035            return ENGLISH.copy();
5036        int poundIndex = data.indexOf('#'), snailIndex = data.indexOf('@'), tempBreak = data.indexOf('℗'),
5037                breakIndex = (tempBreak < 0) ? data.length() : tempBreak,
5038                tildeIndex = Math.min(data.indexOf('~'), breakIndex), prevTildeIndex = -1;
5039        if (tildeIndex < 0)
5040            tildeIndex = breakIndex;
5041
5042        if (snailIndex < 0)
5043            return ENGLISH.copy();
5044        ArrayList<Object> pairs = new ArrayList<>(4);
5045        while (snailIndex >= 0) {
5046            if (poundIndex >= 0 && poundIndex < snailIndex) // random case
5047            {
5048                pairs.add(randomLanguage(Long.parseLong(data.substring(poundIndex + 1, snailIndex))));
5049                pairs.add(StringKit.intFromDec(data, snailIndex + 1, tildeIndex));
5050                poundIndex = -1;
5051            } else {
5052                pairs.add(registry.getAt(Integer.parseInt(data.substring(prevTildeIndex + 1, snailIndex))));
5053                pairs.add(StringKit.intFromDec(data, snailIndex + 1, tildeIndex));
5054            }
5055            snailIndex = data.indexOf('@', snailIndex + 1);
5056            if (snailIndex > breakIndex)
5057                break;
5058            prevTildeIndex = tildeIndex;
5059            tildeIndex = Math.min(data.indexOf('~', tildeIndex + 1), breakIndex);
5060            if (tildeIndex < 0)
5061                tildeIndex = data.length();
5062        }
5063        ArrayList<Modifier> mods = new ArrayList<>(8);
5064        if (breakIndex == tempBreak) {
5065            tildeIndex = breakIndex - 1;
5066            while ((prevTildeIndex = data.indexOf('℗', tildeIndex + 1)) >= 0) {
5067                tildeIndex = data.indexOf('℗', prevTildeIndex + 1);
5068                if (tildeIndex < 0) tildeIndex = data.length();
5069                mods.add(Modifier.deserializeFromString(data.substring(prevTildeIndex, tildeIndex)));
5070            }
5071        }
5072        FakeLanguageGen flg = mixAll(pairs.toArray());
5073        flg.modifiers.addAll(mods);
5074        return flg;
5075    }
5076
5077    public static class Modifier implements Serializable {
5078        private static final long serialVersionUID = 1734863678490422371L;
5079        private transient static final StringBuilder modSB = new StringBuilder(32);
5080        public final Alteration[] alterations;
5081
5082        public Modifier() {
5083            alterations = new Alteration[0];
5084        }
5085
5086        public Modifier(String pattern, String replacement) {
5087            alterations = new Alteration[]{new Alteration(pattern, replacement)};
5088        }
5089
5090        public Modifier(String pattern, String replacement, double chance) {
5091            alterations = new Alteration[]{new Alteration(pattern, replacement, chance)};
5092        }
5093
5094        public Modifier(Alteration... alts) {
5095            alterations = (alts == null) ? new Alteration[0] : alts;
5096        }
5097
5098        public StringBuilder modify(IRNG rng, StringBuilder sb) {
5099            Matcher m;
5100            Replacer.StringBuilderBuffer tb;
5101            boolean found;
5102            Alteration alt;
5103            for (int a = 0; a < alterations.length; a++) {
5104                alt = alterations[a];
5105                modSB.setLength(0);
5106                tb = Replacer.wrap(modSB);
5107                m = alt.replacer.getPattern().matcher(sb);
5108
5109                found = false;
5110                while (true) {
5111                    if (alt.chance >= 1 || rng.nextDouble() < alt.chance) {
5112                        if (!Replacer.replaceStep(m, alt.replacer.getSubstitution(), tb))
5113                            break;
5114                        found = true;
5115                    } else {
5116                        if (!m.find())
5117                            break;
5118                        found = true;
5119                        m.getGroup(MatchResult.PREFIX, tb);
5120                        m.getGroup(MatchResult.MATCH, tb);
5121                        m.setTarget(m, MatchResult.SUFFIX);
5122                    }
5123                }
5124                if (found) {
5125                    m.getGroup(MatchResult.TARGET, tb);
5126                    sb.setLength(0);
5127                    sb.append(modSB);
5128                }
5129            }
5130            return sb;
5131        }

5136        public static final Modifier LISP = new Modifier("[tţťț]?[sśŝşšș]+h?", "th");

5141        public static final Modifier HISS = new Modifier("(.)([sśŝşšșzźżž])+", "$1$2$2$2");

5147                new Alteration("^([^aàáâãäåæāăąǻǽeèéêëēĕėęěiìíîïĩīĭįıoòóôõöøōŏőœǿuùúûüũūŭůűųyýÿŷỳαοειυωаеёийъыэюяоу]+)", "$1-$1", 0.2),
5148                new Alteration("^([aàáâãäåæāăąǻǽeèéêëēĕėęěiìíîïĩīĭįıoòóôõöøōŏőœǿuùúûüũūŭůűųαοειυωаеёийъыэюяоу]+)", "$1-$1", 0.2));

5151         * For a language that has a 40% chance to repeat a single Latin vowel (a, e, o, or a variant on one of them
5152         * like å or ö, but not merged letters like æ and œ).

5154        public static final Modifier DOUBLE_VOWELS = new Modifier(

5156                        + "([aàáâãäåāăąǻeèéêëēĕėęěòóôõöøōŏőǿ])"
5157                        + "([^aàáâãäåæāăąǻǽeèéêëēĕėęěiìíîïĩīĭįıoòóôõöøōŏőœǿuùúûüũūŭůűųyýÿŷỳ]|$)", "$1$2$2$3", 0.4);

5164                "([^aàáâãäåæāăąǻǽeèéêëēĕėęěiìíîïĩīĭįıoòóôõöøōŏőœǿuùúûüũūŭůűųyýÿŷỳαοειυωаеёийъыэюяоуqwhjx])" +

5168         * For a language that never repeats the same letter twice in a row.
5169         */
5170        public static final Modifier NO_DOUBLES = new Modifier("(.)\\1", "$1");

5172        /**
5173         * Removes accented letters and the two non-English consonants from text generated with {@link #NORSE}.
5174         * Replaces á, é, í, ý, ó, æ, ú, and ö with a, e, i, y, o, ae, and ou. In some instances, replaces j
5175         * with y. Replaces ð and þ with th and th, except for when preceded by s (then it replaces sð or sþ
5176         * with st or st) or when the start of a word is fð or fþ, where it replaces with fr or fr.
5177         */
5178        public static final Modifier SIMPLIFY_NORSE = replacementTable(
5179                "á", "a",
5180                "é", "e",
5181                "í", "i",
5182                "ý", "y",
5183                "ó", "o",
5184                "ú", "u",
5185                "æ", "ae",
5186                "ö", "ou",
5187                "([^aeiou])jy", "$1yai",
5188                "([^aeiou])j(?:[aeiouy]+)", "$1yo",
5189                "s([ðþ])", "st",
5190                "\\bf[ðþ]", "fr",
5191                "[ðþ]", "th");
5192
5193        /**
5194         * Simple changes to merge "ae" into "æ", "oe" into "œ", and any of "aé", "áe", or "áé" into "ǽ".
5195         */
5196        public static final Modifier LIGATURES = replacementTable("ae", "æ", "oe", "œ", "áe", "ǽ", "aé", "ǽ", "áé", "ǽ");
5197
5198        /**
5199         * Simple changes to merge "æ" into "ae", "œ" into "oe", and "ǽ" into "áe".
5200         */
5201        public static final Modifier SPLIT_LIGATURES = replacementTable("æ", "ae", "œ", "oe", "ǽ", "áe");
5202        /**
5203         * Some changes that can be applied when sanity checks (which force re-generating a new word) aren't appropriate
5204         * for fixing a word that isn't pronounceable.
5205         */
5206        public static final Modifier GENERAL_CLEANUP = replacementTable(
5207                "[æǽœìíîïĩīĭįıiùúûüũūŭůűųuýÿŷỳy]([æǽœýÿŷỳy])", "$1",
5208                "q([ùúûüũūŭůűųu])$", "q$1e",
5209                "([ìíîïĩīĭįıi])[ìíîïĩīĭįıi]", "$1",
5210                "([æǽœìíîïĩīĭįıiùúûüũūŭůűųuýÿŷỳy])[wŵẁẃẅ]$", "$1",
5211                "([ùúûüũūŭůűųu])([òóôõöøōŏőǿo])", "$2$1",
5212                "[àáâãäåāăąǻaèéêëēĕėęěeìíîïĩīĭįıiòóôõöøōŏőǿoùúûüũūŭůűųuýÿŷỳy]([æǽœ])", "$1",
5213                "([æǽœ])[àáâãäåāăąǻaèéêëēĕėęěeìíîïĩīĭįıiòóôõöøōŏőǿoùúûüũūŭůűųuýÿŷỳy]", "$1",
5214                "([wŵẁẃẅ])[wŵẁẃẅ]", "$1",
5215                "qq", "q");
5216
5217        //àáâãäåāăąǻæǽaèéêëēĕėęěeìíîïĩīĭįıiòóôõöøōŏőœǿoùúûüũūŭůűųuýÿŷỳy
5218        //bcçćĉċčdþðďđfgĝğġģhĥħjĵȷkķlĺļľŀłmnñńņňŋpqrŕŗřsśŝşšștţťțvwŵẁẃẅxyýÿŷỳzźżž
5219
5220        /**
5221         * Creates a Modifier that will replace the nth char in initial with the nth char in change. Expects initial and
5222         * change to be the same length, but will use the lesser length if they are not equal-length. Because of the
5223         * state of the text at the time modifiers are run, only lower-case letters need to be searched for.
5224         *
5225         * @param initial a String containing lower-case letters or other symbols to be swapped out of a text
5226         * @param change  a String containing characters that will replace occurrences of characters in initial
5227         * @return a Modifier that can be added to a FakeLanguageGen with its addModifiers() method
5228         */
5229        public static Modifier charReplacementTable(String initial, String change) {
5230            Alteration[] alts = new Alteration[Math.min(initial.length(), change.length())];
5231            for (int i = 0; i < alts.length; i++) {
5232                //literal string syntax; avoids sensitive escaping issues and also doesn't need a character class,
5233                // which is slightly slower and has some odd escaping cases.
5234                alts[i] = new Alteration("\\Q" + initial.charAt(i), change.substring(i, i + 1));
5235            }
5236            return new Modifier(alts);
5237        }
5238
5239        /**
5240         * Creates a Modifier that will replace the nth String key in map with the nth value. Because of the
5241         * state of the text at the time modifiers are run, only lower-case letters need to be searched for.
5242         * This overload of replacementTable allows full regex pattern strings as keys and replacement syntax,
5243         * such as searching for "([aeiou])\\1+" to find repeated occurrences of the same vowel, and "$1" in
5244         * this example to replace the repeated section with only the first vowel.
5245         * The ordering of map matters if a later key contains an earlier key (the earlier one will be replaced
5246         * first, possibly making the later key not match), or if an earlier replacement causes a later one to
5247         * become valid.
5248         *
5249         * @param map containing String keys to replace and String values to use instead; replacements happen in order
5250         * @return a Modifier that can be added to a FakeLanguageGen with its addModifiers() method
5251         */
5252        public static Modifier replacementTable(OrderedMap<String, String> map) {
5253            if (map == null)
5254                return new Modifier();
5255            Alteration[] alts = new Alteration[map.size()];
5256            for (int i = 0; i < alts.length; i++) {
5257                alts[i] = new Alteration(map.keyAt(i), map.getAt(i));
5258            }
5259            return new Modifier(alts);
5260        }
5261
5262        /**
5263         * Creates a Modifier that will replace the (n*2)th String in pairs with the (n*2+1)th value in pairs. Because
5264         * of the state of the text at the time modifiers are run, only lower-case letters need to be searched for.
5265         * This overload of replacementTable allows full regex syntax for search and replacement Strings,
5266         * such as searching for "([aeiou])\\1+" to find repeated occurrences of the same vowel, and "$1" in
5267         * this example to replace the repeated section with only the first vowel.
5268         * The ordering of pairs matters if a later search contains an earlier search (the earlier one will be replaced
5269         * first, possibly making the later search not match), or if an earlier replacement causes a later one to
5270         * become valid.
5271         *
5272         * @param pairs array or vararg of alternating Strings to search for and Strings to replace with; replacements happen in order
5273         * @return a Modifier that can be added to a FakeLanguageGen with its addModifiers() method
5274         */
5275        public static Modifier replacementTable(String... pairs) {
5276            int len;
5277            if (pairs == null || (len = pairs.length) <= 1)
5278                return new Modifier();
5279            Alteration[] alts = new Alteration[len >> 1];
5280            for (int i = 0; i < alts.length; i++) {
5281                alts[i] = new Alteration(pairs[i<< 1], pairs[i<<1|1]);
5282            }
5283            return new Modifier(alts);
5284        }

5286        /**
5287         * Adds the potential for the String {@code insertion} to be used as a vowel in addition to the vowels that the
5288         * language already uses; insertion will replace an existing vowel (at any point in a word that had a vowel
5289         * generated) with a probability of {@code chance}, so chance should be low (0.1 at most) unless you want the
5290         * newly-inserted vowel to be likely to be present in every word of some sentences.
5291         * @param insertion the String to use as an additional vowel
5292         * @param chance the chance for a vowel cluster to be replaced with insertion; normally 0.1 or less
5293         * @return a Modifier that can be added to a FakeLanguageGen with its addModifiers() method
5294         */
5295        public static Modifier insertVowel(String insertion, double chance)
5296        {
5297            return new Modifier(anyVowelCluster, insertion, chance);
5298        }

5400        @Override
5401        public boolean equals(Object o) {
5402            if (this == o) return true;
5403            if (o == null || getClass() != o.getClass()) return false;
5404
5405            Modifier modifier = (Modifier) o;
5406
5407            // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
5408            return Arrays.equals(alterations, modifier.alterations);
5409        }
5410
5411        @Override
5412        public int hashCode() {
5413            return CrossHash.hash(alterations);
5414        }
5415
5416        @Override
5417        public String toString() {
5418            return "Modifier{" +
5419                    "alterations=" + Arrays.toString(alterations) +
5420                    '}';
5421        }
5422
5423        public String serializeToString() {
5424            if (alterations.length == 0) return "\6";
5425            modSB.setLength(0);
5426            modSB.append('\6');
5427            for (int i = 0; i < alterations.length; i++)
5428                modSB.append(alterations[i].serializeToString()).append('\6');
5429            return modSB.toString();
5430        }
5431
5432        public static Modifier deserializeFromString(String data) {
5433            int currIdx = data.indexOf(6), altIdx = currIdx, matches = 0;
5434            while (currIdx >= 0) {
5435                if ((currIdx = data.indexOf(6, currIdx + 1)) < 0)
5436                    break;
5437                matches++;
5438            }
5439            Alteration[] alts = new Alteration[matches];
5440            for (int i = 0; i < matches; i++) {
5441                alts[i] = Alteration.deserializeFromString(data.substring(altIdx + 1, altIdx = data.indexOf(6, altIdx + 1)));
5442            }
5443            return new Modifier(alts);
5444        }
5445    }
5446
5447    public static class Alteration implements Serializable {
5448        private static final long serialVersionUID = -2138854697837563188L;
5449        public Replacer replacer;
5450        public String replacement;
5451        public double chance;
5452
5453        public Alteration() {
5454            this("[tţťț]?[sśŝşšș]+h?", "th");
5455        }
5456
5457        public Alteration(String pattern, String replacement) {
5458            this.replacement = replacement;
5459            replacer = Pattern.compile(pattern).replacer(replacement);
5460            chance = 1.0;
5461        }
5462
5463        public Alteration(String pattern, String replacement, double chance) {
5464            this.replacement = replacement;
5465            replacer = Pattern.compile(pattern).replacer(replacement);
5466            this.chance = chance;
5467        }
5468
5469        public Alteration(Pattern pattern, String replacement, double chance) {
5470            this.replacement = replacement;
5471            replacer = pattern.replacer(replacement);
5472            this.chance = chance;
5473        }
5474
5475        @Override
5476        public boolean equals(Object o) {
5477            if (this == o) return true;
5478            if (o == null || getClass() != o.getClass()) return false;
5479
5480            Alteration that = (Alteration) o;
5481
5482            if (Double.compare(that.chance, chance) != 0) return false;
5483            return replacer.equals(that.replacer);
5484
5485        }
5486
5487        @Override
5488        public int hashCode() {
5489            long result;
5490            result = CrossHash.hash64(replacer.getPattern().serializeToString());
5491            result = 31L * result + NumberTools.doubleToLongBits(chance);
5492            result ^= result >>> 32;
5493            return (int) (0xFFFFFFFFL & result);
5494        }
5495
5496        @Override
5497        public String toString() {
5498            return "Alteration{" +
5499                    "replacer=" + replacer +
5500                    ", chance=" + chance +
5501                    '}';
5502        }
5503
5504        public String serializeToString() {
5505            return replacer.getPattern().serializeToString() + '\2' + replacement + '\4' + chance;
5506        }
5507
5508        public static Alteration deserializeFromString(String data) {
5509            int split2 = data.indexOf('\2'), split4 = data.indexOf('\4');
5510            return new Alteration(Pattern.deserializeFromString(data.substring(0, split2)),
5511                    data.substring(split2 + 1, split4),
5512                    Double.parseDouble(data.substring(split4 + 1)));
5513        }
5514    }

5516    /**
5517     * A simple way to bundle a FakeLanguageGen with the arguments that would be passed to it when calling
5518     * {@link FakeLanguageGen#sentence(IRNG, int, int, String[], String[], double, int)} or one of its overloads.
5519     * You can call {@link #sentence()} on this to produce another String sentence with the parameters it was given
5520     * at construction. The parameters to
5521     * {@link #SentenceForm(FakeLanguageGen, IStatefulRNG, int, int, String[], String[], double, int)} are stored in fields of
5522     * the same name, and all fields in this class are public and modifiable.
5523     */
5524    public static class SentenceForm implements Serializable
5525    {
5526        private static final long serialVersionUID = 1246527948419533147L;
5527        public IStatefulRNG rng;
5528        public int minWords, maxWords, maxChars;
5529        public String[] midPunctuation, endPunctuation;
5530        public double midPunctuationFrequency;
5531        public FakeLanguageGen language;
5532
5533        /**
5534         * Builds a SentenceForm with all default fields, using {@link FakeLanguageGen#FANTASY_NAME} for a language,
5535         * using between 1 and 9 words in a sentence, and otherwise defaulting to how
5536         * {@link #SentenceForm(FakeLanguageGen, int, int)} behaves.
5537         */
5538        public SentenceForm()
5539        {
5540            this(FakeLanguageGen.FANTASY_NAME, FakeLanguageGen.srng, 1, 9,
5541                    mid,
5542                    end, 0.18, -1);
5543        }
5544        /**
5545         * Builds a SentenceForm with only a few fields specified. The {@link #rng} will be made based on
5546         * FakeLanguageGen's static {@link FakeLanguageGen#srng} field, maxChars will be -1 so the sentence length
5547         * will be limited only by maxWords and the length of words produced, and the between-word and end-of-sentence
5548         * punctuation will be set to reasonable defaults. This places either a comma or a semicolon after a word in the
5549         * middle of a sentence about 18% of the time ({@code midPunctuationFrequency} is 0.18), and can end a sentence
5550         * in a period, exclamation mark, question mark, or ellipsis (the "..." punctuation).
5551         * @param language A FakeLanguageGen to use to generate words
5552         * @param minWords minimum words per sentence
5553         * @param maxWords maximum words per sentence
5554         */
5555        public SentenceForm(FakeLanguageGen language, int minWords, int maxWords)
5556        {
5557            this(language, FakeLanguageGen.srng, minWords, maxWords, mid,
5558                    end, 0.18, -1);
5559        }
5560        /**
5561         * Builds a SentenceForm with all fields specified except for {@link #rng}, which will be made based on
5562         * FakeLanguageGen's static {@link FakeLanguageGen#srng} field, and maxChars, which means the sentence length
5563         * will be limited only by maxWords and the length of words produced.
5564         * @param language A FakeLanguageGen to use to generate words
5565         * @param minWords minimum words per sentence
5566         * @param maxWords maximum words per sentence
5567         * @param midPunctuation an array of Strings that can be used immediately after words in the middle of sentences, like "," or ";"
5568         * @param endPunctuation an array of Strings that can end a sentence, like ".", "?", or "..."
5569         * @param midPunctuationFrequency the probability that two words will be separated by a String from midPunctuation, between 0.0 and 1.0
5570         */
5571        public SentenceForm(FakeLanguageGen language, int minWords, int maxWords, String[] midPunctuation,
5572                            String[] endPunctuation, double midPunctuationFrequency)
5573        {
5574            this(language, FakeLanguageGen.srng, minWords, maxWords, midPunctuation, endPunctuation,
5575                    midPunctuationFrequency, -1);
5576        }
5577        /**
5578         * Builds a SentenceForm with all fields specified except for {@link #rng}, which will be made based on
5579         * FakeLanguageGen's static {@link FakeLanguageGen#srng} field.
5580         * @param language A FakeLanguageGen to use to generate words
5581         * @param minWords minimum words per sentence
5582         * @param maxWords maximum words per sentence
5583         * @param midPunctuation an array of Strings that can be used immediately after words in the middle of sentences, like "," or ";"
5584         * @param endPunctuation an array of Strings that can end a sentence, like ".", "?", or "..."
5585         * @param midPunctuationFrequency the probability that two words will be separated by a String from midPunctuation, between 0.0 and 1.0
5586         * @param maxChars the maximum number of chars to use in a sentence, or -1 for no hard limit
5587         */
5588        public SentenceForm(FakeLanguageGen language, int minWords, int maxWords, String[] midPunctuation,
5589                            String[] endPunctuation, double midPunctuationFrequency, int maxChars)
5590        {
5591            this(language, FakeLanguageGen.srng, minWords, maxWords, midPunctuation, endPunctuation,
5592                    midPunctuationFrequency, maxChars);
5593        }
5594
5595        /**
5596         * Builds a SentenceForm with all fields specified; each value is referenced directly except for {@code rng},
5597         * which will not change or be directly referenced (a new GWTRNG will be used with the same state value).
5598         * @param language A FakeLanguageGen to use to generate words
5599         * @param rng a StatefulRNG that will not be directly referenced; the state will be copied into a new StatefulRNG
5600         * @param minWords minimum words per sentence
5601         * @param maxWords maximum words per sentence
5602         * @param midPunctuation an array of Strings that can be used immediately after words in the middle of sentences, like "," or ";"
5603         * @param endPunctuation an array of Strings that can end a sentence, like ".", "?", or "..."
5604         * @param midPunctuationFrequency the probability that two words will be separated by a String from midPunctuation, between 0.0 and 1.0
5605         * @param maxChars the maximum number of chars to use in a sentence, or -1 for no hard limit
5606         */
5607        public SentenceForm(FakeLanguageGen language, IStatefulRNG rng, int minWords, int maxWords,
5608                            String[] midPunctuation, String[] endPunctuation,
5609                            double midPunctuationFrequency, int maxChars)
5610        {
5611            this.language = language;
5612            this.rng = new GWTRNG(rng.getState());
5613            this.minWords = minWords;
5614            this.maxWords = maxWords;
5615            this.midPunctuation = midPunctuation;
5616            this.endPunctuation = endPunctuation;
5617            this.midPunctuationFrequency = midPunctuationFrequency;
5618            this.maxChars = maxChars;
5619        }
5620        public String sentence()
5621        {
5622            return language.sentence(rng, minWords, maxWords, midPunctuation, endPunctuation,
5623                    midPunctuationFrequency, maxChars);
5624        }
5625
5626        public String serializeToString() {
5627            return language.serializeToString() + '℘' +
5628                    rng.getState() + '℘' +
5629                    minWords + '℘' +
5630                    maxWords + '℘' +
5631                    StringKit.join("ℙ", midPunctuation) + '℘' +
5632                    StringKit.join("ℙ", endPunctuation) + '℘' +
5633                    NumberTools.doubleToLongBits(midPunctuationFrequency) + '℘' +
5634                    maxChars;
5635        }
5636        public static SentenceForm deserializeFromString(String ser)
5637        {
5638            int gap = ser.indexOf('℘');
5639            FakeLanguageGen lang = FakeLanguageGen.deserializeFromString(ser.substring(0, gap));
5640            GWTRNG rng = new GWTRNG(
5641                    StringKit.longFromDec(ser,gap + 1, gap = ser.indexOf('℘', gap + 1)));
5642            int minWords = StringKit.intFromDec(ser,gap + 1, gap = ser.indexOf('℘', gap + 1));
5643            int maxWords = StringKit.intFromDec(ser,gap + 1, gap = ser.indexOf('℘', gap + 1));
5644            String[] midPunctuation =
5645                    StringKit.split(ser.substring(gap + 1, gap = ser.indexOf('℘', gap + 1)), "ℙ");
5646            String[] endPunctuation =
5647                    StringKit.split(ser.substring(gap + 1, gap = ser.indexOf('℘', gap + 1)), "ℙ");
5648            double midFreq = NumberTools.longBitsToDouble(StringKit.longFromDec(ser,gap + 1, gap = ser.indexOf('℘', gap + 1)));
5649            int maxChars = StringKit.intFromDec(ser,gap + 1, ser.length());
5650            return new SentenceForm(lang, rng, minWords, maxWords, midPunctuation, endPunctuation, midFreq, maxChars);
5651        }
5652    }
5653}
